intro: Galium abaujense subsp. polonicum, commonly known as the Polish bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, prostrate or ascending stems. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, oval to lanceolate, and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
